screen_design_ref: Figure 26.1: System Test Plans List Page
description: Verify that the test plans list page loads correctly with proper authentication
scenario: Admin user navigates to the system test plans list to view and manage all test plans
expected_results: Display the test plans list page with header, filters, and test plans table
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check header with 'System Test Plans' title
5. Verify 'Dashboard' and 'New Test Plan' buttons are visible

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the test plans list page
scenario: Regular user attempts to access the test plans management functionality
expected_results: Access should be denied with 403 Forbidden error
procedure:
1. Log in as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans
3. Verify 403 Forbidden error is returned
4. Check redirect to appropriate error page
5. Ensure no test plans data is accessible

description: Verify that the filters section displays all filter options correctly
scenario: Admin views the filters section to understand available filtering options
expected_results: Display filters section with Module, Status, Priority, Category dropdowns and Filter button
procedure:
1. Navigate to test plans list page
2. Verify filters section has gray background and proper styling
3. Check Module filter dropdown with 'All Modules' default option
4. Confirm Status filter with options: All Status, Pending, Passed, Failed, Skipped
5. Verify Priority filter with options: All Priorities, Low, Medium, High, Critical
6. Check Category filter with options: All Categories, Functional, UI, Performance, Security, Integration

description: Verify that the module filter displays available modules and filters correctly
scenario: Admin uses module filter to view test plans for specific modules
expected_results: Module filter shows all available modules and filters test plans when selected
procedure:
1. Open module filter dropdown
2. Verify 'All Modules' is first option
3. Check that actual module names appear in sorted order
4. Select a specific module and click Filter button
5. Verify only test plans for selected module are displayed

description: Verify that the status filter correctly filters test plans by execution status
scenario: Admin uses status filter to view test plans with specific execution status
expected_results: Status filter shows only test plans matching the selected status
procedure:
1. Create test plans with different statuses (pending, passed, failed, skipped)
2. Select 'Passed' from status filter
3. Click Filter button
4. Verify only passed test plans are displayed
5. Test with other status options and verify filtering works correctly

description: Verify that the priority filter correctly filters test plans by priority level
scenario: Admin uses priority filter to view test plans with specific priority levels
expected_results: Priority filter shows only test plans matching the selected priority
procedure:
1. Create test plans with different priorities (low, medium, high, critical)
2. Select 'High' from priority filter
3. Click Filter button
4. Verify only high priority test plans are displayed
5. Test with other priority options and verify filtering works correctly

description: Verify that the category filter correctly filters test plans by test category
scenario: Admin uses category filter to view test plans of specific test categories
expected_results: Category filter shows only test plans matching the selected category
procedure:
1. Create test plans with different categories (functional, ui, performance, security, integration)
2. Select 'Security' from category filter
3. Click Filter button
4. Verify only security test plans are displayed
5. Test with other category options and verify filtering works correctly

description: Verify that multiple filters work correctly when used in combination
scenario: Admin uses multiple filters simultaneously to find specific test plans
expected_results: All filters work together to show only test plans matching all selected criteria
procedure:
1. Select 'Home Page' from module filter
2. Select 'Failed' from status filter
3. Select 'High' from priority filter
4. Click Filter button
5. Verify only test plans matching all three criteria are displayed

description: Verify that the test plans table displays all required columns and information
scenario: Admin reviews test plans table to understand test plan details and status
expected_results: Table displays columns for Test Plan, Module, Description, Status, Priority, Category, and Actions
procedure:
1. View test plans table
2. Verify table headers: Test Plan, Module, Description, Status, Priority, Category, Actions
3. Check table has proper styling with borders and hover effects
4. Confirm responsive design with horizontal scroll on smaller screens
5. Verify proper text alignment (left for text, center for badges/actions)

description: Verify that test plan numbers are clickable links that navigate to test plan details
scenario: Admin clicks on test plan numbers to view detailed test plan information
expected_results: Test plan numbers are clickable links that navigate to test plan view page
procedure:
1. Locate test plan numbers in the table
2. Verify they are styled as blue links
3. Click on a test plan number link
4. Verify navigation to test plan view page with correct test_plan_id
5. Confirm link hover effects work correctly

description: Verify that long test plan descriptions are properly truncated in table view
scenario: Admin views test plans with varying description lengths in the table
expected_results: Long descriptions are truncated with max-width and ellipsis for readability
procedure:
1. Create test plans with very long descriptions
2. View test plans table
3. Verify descriptions use max-width truncation (max-w-xs)
4. Check that truncated descriptions show ellipsis
5. Confirm table layout remains consistent regardless of description length

description: Verify that status badges display with correct colors and text for all status types
scenario: Admin reviews test plan status badges to quickly identify test execution status
expected_results: Status badges use correct colors: green (passed), red (failed), yellow (pending), gray (skipped)
procedure:
1. Create test plans with all four status types
2. View test plans table
3. Verify 'passed' status shows green badge with 'passed' text
4. Check 'failed' status shows red badge with 'failed' text
5. Confirm 'pending' status shows yellow badge with 'pending' text
6. Verify 'skipped' status shows gray badge with 'skipped' text

description: Verify that priority badges display with correct colors and text for all priority levels
scenario: Admin reviews test plan priority badges to understand test criticality
expected_results: Priority badges use correct colors: red (critical), orange (high), yellow (medium), green (low)
procedure:
1. Create test plans with all four priority levels
2. View test plans table
3. Verify 'critical' priority shows red badge with 'critical' text
4. Check 'high' priority shows orange badge with 'high' text
5. Confirm 'medium' priority shows yellow badge with 'medium' text
6. Verify 'low' priority shows green badge with 'low' text

description: Verify that category badges display consistently with blue styling
scenario: Admin reviews test plan category badges to understand test types
expected_results: All category badges use consistent blue styling regardless of category type
procedure:
1. Create test plans with different categories (functional, ui, performance, security, integration)
2. View test plans table
3. Verify all category badges use blue background (bg-blue-100)
4. Check badge text shows correct category name
5. Confirm consistent styling across all category types

description: Verify that action buttons (Execute, Edit, Delete) work correctly for each test plan
scenario: Admin uses action buttons to execute, edit, and delete test plans
expected_results: Action buttons navigate to correct pages and perform intended functions
procedure:
1. Locate action buttons in test plan table rows
2. Click Execute button (play-circle icon) and verify navigation to test execution page
3. Click Edit button (pencil icon) and verify navigation to test plan edit form
4. Click Delete button (trash icon) and verify delete confirmation modal appears
5. Confirm all buttons have proper hover effects and tooltips

description: Verify that the search input filters test plans in real-time
scenario: Admin uses search input to find specific test plans by text content
expected_results: Search filters test plans in real-time based on all visible table content
procedure:
1. Locate search input with placeholder 'Search test plans...'
2. Type partial test plan number (e.g., 'STP-001')
3. Verify matching test plans remain visible while others are hidden
4. Clear search and type module name
5. Confirm filtering works for all table text content

description: Verify that the delete confirmation modal displays correctly and functions properly
scenario: Admin attempts to delete a test plan and is presented with confirmation dialog
expected_results: Delete modal shows test plan information and requires confirmation before deletion
procedure:
1. Click delete button for a test plan
2. Verify modal appears with proper styling and backdrop
3. Check modal shows test plan number in confirmation message
4. Verify 'Cancel' button closes modal without deleting
5. Confirm 'Delete' button submits delete form with correct test plan ID

description: Verify the empty state display when no test plans exist or match filters
scenario: Admin views test plans list when no test plans exist or filters return no results
expected_results: Display empty state with inbox icon, message, and action buttons
procedure:
1. Clear all test plans from system or use filters that return no results
2. Navigate to test plans list
3. Verify empty state shows inbox icon
4. Check message 'No test plans found'
5. Confirm 'Create Test Plan' and 'Bulk Import' buttons are present and functional

description: Verify that the test plans count is displayed correctly in the table header
scenario: Admin views the test plans count to understand total number of test plans
expected_results: Table header shows accurate count of displayed test plans
procedure:
1. View test plans table header
2. Verify 'Test Plans (X found)' shows correct count
3. Apply filters and confirm count updates correctly
4. Clear filters and verify count shows total test plans
5. Check count updates when search is applied

description: Verify the page header contains proper title, description, and navigation buttons
scenario: Admin reviews page header for clear navigation and context
expected_results: Display header with title, description, dashboard link, and new test plan button
procedure:
1. Check page title 'System Test Plans' is displayed prominently
2. Verify description 'Manage and execute system test plans'
3. Confirm 'Dashboard' button navigates to system test dashboard
4. Check 'New Test Plan' button navigates to test plan creation form
5. Verify proper button styling with icons

description: Verify that table rows have appropriate hover effects for better user experience
scenario: Admin hovers over table rows to see visual feedback
expected_results: Table rows show hover effects with background color change
procedure:
1. Hover over table rows
2. Verify background color changes to gray on hover
3. Check hover effect works consistently across all rows
4. Confirm hover doesn't interfere with action button clicks
5. Verify transition is smooth and professional

description: Verify that filter states are maintained in URL parameters and can be bookmarked
scenario: Admin applies filters and wants to bookmark or share the filtered view
expected_results: Filter selections are reflected in URL parameters and persist on page reload
procedure:
1. Apply various filters (module, status, priority, category)
2. Check URL contains filter parameters
3. Reload page and verify filters remain applied
4. Bookmark URL and navigate away
5. Return via bookmark and confirm filters are still applied

description: Verify that the test plans table adapts correctly to different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses test plans list from various devices to ensure responsive design
expected_results: Table remains usable on all screen sizes with horizontal scroll when needed
procedure:
1. View table on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Test on tablet view (768px width)
3. Check mobile view (375px width)
4. Verify horizontal scroll appears on smaller screens
5. Confirm all columns remain accessible and readable

description: Verify proper error handling when test plans data cannot be loaded
scenario: Test plans list encounters an error while loading data from the database
expected_results: Display appropriate error handling with 500 error page
procedure:
1. Simulate database connection error
2. Navigate to test plans list page
3. Verify error is logged properly
4. Check 500 error page is displayed
5. Confirm no sensitive information is exposed to user

description: Verify that the quick status update functionality works via AJAX API
scenario: Admin uses quick status update feature to change test plan status without page reload
expected_results: Status updates work via AJAX with proper confirmation and error handling
procedure:
1. Call updateStatus JavaScript function with test plan ID
2. Verify confirmation dialog appears
3. Confirm API call is made to /admin/system-test/api/test-plans/{id}/status
4. Check status update reflects in database
5. Verify page reloads to show updated status

description: Verify that the test plans list displays correctly in both light and dark themes
scenario: Admin switches between light and dark modes to ensure proper theming support
expected_results: All test plans list elements display with appropriate colors and contrast in both themes
procedure:
1. View test plans list in light mode
2. Switch to dark mode (if theme toggle available)
3. Verify all text remains readable with proper contrast
4. Check table and filter sections use appropriate dark theme colors
5. Confirm status and priority badges adapt to theme correctly

description: Verify test plans list performance with large numbers of test plans
scenario: Admin views test plans list with hundreds of test plans to ensure performance
expected_results: Page loads efficiently and search/filtering remains responsive with large datasets
procedure:
1. Create system with 500+ test plans
2. Navigate to test plans list and measure load time
3. Test search filtering performance with large dataset
4. Verify filter operations remain fast
5. Check memory usage remains reasonable

description: Verify test plans list works correctly across different web browsers
scenario: Admin accesses test plans list using various browsers to ensure cross-browser compatibility
expected_results: Test plans list displays and functions correctly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers
procedure:
1. Test test plans list in Google Chrome (latest version)
2. Verify functionality in Mozilla Firefox
3. Check display and features in Safari (if available)
4. Test in Microsoft Edge browser
5. Confirm all interactive elements work in each browser

description: Verify test plans list meets accessibility standards for screen readers and keyboard navigation
scenario: Admin and accessibility tools test test plans list for compliance with accessibility standards
expected_results: Test plans list is fully accessible via keyboard navigation and screen readers
procedure:
1. Navigate entire page using only keyboard (Tab, Enter, arrows)
2. Test with screen reader for proper content reading
3. Verify focus indicators are visible on all interactive elements
4. Check color contrast meets accessibility standards
5. Confirm proper aria labels and semantic HTML structure

screen_design_ref: Figure 26.30: Integration with Test Management Workflow
description: Verify test plans list integrates properly with broader test management functionality
scenario: Admin uses test plans list as part of complete test management workflow
expected_results: Test plans list provides seamless integration with dashboard, test creation, execution, and editing
procedure:
1. Navigate from dashboard to test plans list
2. Create new test plan from test plans list
3. Execute test from test plans list
4. Edit test plan from test plans list
5. Verify all integrations maintain proper context and navigation flow
